DataElement.preferredName: Care Team Member National Provider Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The role of an individual healthcare provider as a constituent part of a group.:A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.:An individual healthcare provider that is a part of a care team._A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The role of an individual healthcare provider as a constituent part of a group.

Concepts.definition: An individual healthcare provider that is a part of a care team.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
